Name: Select elements with XPath
Description: Can I select one or more elements using XPath expression?

Chrome.Notes: `$x(path [, startNode])` returns an array of DOM elements that match the given XPath expression. It has an optional second parameter, `startNode`, that specifies an element or Node from which to search for elements.

Firefox.Notes: 1. `$x(path [, startNode])` returns an array of DOM elements that match the given XPath expression. It has an optional second parameter, `startNode`, that specifies an element or Node from which to search for elements.

Edge.Notes: `$x(path [, startNode])` returns an array of DOM elements that match the given XPath expression. It has an optional second parameter, `startNode`, that specifies an element or Node from which to search for elements.

Safari.Notes: `$x(path [, startNode])` returns an array of DOM elements that match the given XPath expression. It has an optional second parameter, `startNode`, that specifies an element or Node from which to search for elements.

Opera.Notes: `$x(path [, startNode])` returns an array of DOM elements that match the given XPath expression. It has an optional second parameter, `startNode`, that specifies an element or Node from which to search for elements.
